BearCatBus

Like the LED electronic display panels of NYC's subways system, BearCatBus serves as a guide to students traveling around the Binghamton area who do not always have full schedule on hand or find it cumbersome on a tight schedule to worry about details such as finding the nearest bus stop. BearCatBus digitizes the Off Campus College Transport schedule and route information to provide real-time information to the thousands of students who ride daily, especially those living off-campus.

Ideally the app would provide an opt-in service which would use geolocation from the user to find the nearest bus stops.

LetsGetHeard

LetsGetHeard is a WordPress powered website developed for people who create their own music. It is perfect for DJ's, producers, and any musician that wants to spread their music and receive great feedback. LetsGetHeard is created mainly around two plugins, BuddyPress and myCRED. Together these plugins create a social network for users to upload new music, make friends, give feedback, ask questions...etc, all in the while of getting points and increasing their reputation on the website. Doing things like listening to other users' music, commenting, logging in every day, and even just registering get the user points. These points place users higher on the community leaderboard and get their music featured on the front page for more publicity.

LetsGetHeard is a great way to explore new music, make friends, and gain publicity as an artist.

Don't you hate it when you're driving or biking, and have to share the road with your enemy, those drivers or bikers? Our app is built to help provide quick and interactive traffic information to those who need it. The user can customize the distance which the app uses to determine the traffic conditions over. nüLife

nüLife has two pathways. The first is GetStarted, which is designed for those who are unfamiliar with budgeting expenses. You give us your salary and zipcode, and we give you real time estimates of local prices for things like gasoline, utilities, rent, and even weather. We then suggest how much you should be spending and saving based on the information you provided. The other option is GetOrganized, which is for users who know how to manage a budget but want to be more organized. You give us your information, such as salary, zipcode, monthly rent, car payments, phone bills, and more. We compare this with estimated pricing local to you and help develop a balanced budget with a savings aspect for you.

hutl

A social media application in which users can set specific times for a chat room to open. A chat room can be created by any user and other users must be invited to participate in a chat room. Each chat room may be limited to 4-5 people because the application is designed in a way to help foster personal relationships. Each participant of a chat is notified when it is available and an opportunity to spend a set period of time communicating with people that the user would like to talk to. The chat room will stay open only for a short period of time but if the conversation is going well, the users may vote to extend the duration. The limited accessibility of the chat room will help to motivate users to attend while the opportunity exists. The application will include a “vault” in which users can add text, pictures or videos at any time. The items from the vault can be shared live in a chat room with others.

  • web

Hax

Hax is a fast-paced retro game with intense multiplayer action. Strategize to take down your opponent by finding a path to the other side.

Pathfinding, and retro gaming: what more could a HackBU Hacker ask for?

Developed By:

Zachary Feuerstein, Zachary Lite, and Isaac Patka

Gameplay:

Move up and down and fire at the right block to remove it from the board and watch all connected blocks disappear as well. If you fire at a block that is connected with the same color all the way to the other side the other player will lose health. First player to get rid of the the other players health wins.

Instructions:

Press 1 to play against a strategic AI

Press 2 to play against a friend

Player 1 Controls: W = up, S = down, Left Shift = fire

Player 2 Controls: Up Arrow = up, Down Arrow = down, Right Shift = fire

PlayBits

In PlayBits, Pebble users battle each other in a pattern-matching game with the help of their Bitlets (data daemons that fight for your honor). Bitlets are collectible sprites that you can earn via battling other PlayBits users in the BitletArena (the pattern-matching game).

PlayBits users utilize an inter-pebble connection (via an android app intermediary) in order to send each other their Bitlets for battle. Each round, they see the same sequence of button-presses, and the first one to recreate the button-presses incorrectly loses.

The winner gets a copy of the loser's sprite, and expands his collection of Bitlets.

  • bluetooth

Game of Life

This is my first program on a hackathon.

The mathematical game of life devised by John Horton Conway, in JAVA. We saw this once in class, and I've wanted to create a more complete version. This program will create a random seed, and bases the dimension of the board on the size of the screen it is being executed upon. Also, it will continue to do infinitely many generations of the game, so you can see how the board evolves and develops.
